CommandDoccommentNode.comment:
Given a solution `x` to a divisibility constraint `a ∣ b * x + c`, then `x % d` is another solution as long as `(a / gcd a b) | d`.
See `dvd_emod_add_of_dvd_add` for the specialization with `b = 1`. -/

AtomNode.val:
Given a solution `x` to a divisibility constraint `a ∣ b * x + c`, then `x % d` is another solution as long as `(a / gcd a b) | d`.
See `dvd_emod_add_of_dvd_add` for the specialization with `b = 1`. -/

OtherNode.state_before: a b c d x : Int w : a ∣ b * x + c h : a / ↑(a.gcd b) ∣ d ⊢ a ∣ b * (x % d) + c
OtherNode.state_after: case intro a b c d x : Int h : a / ↑(a.gcd b) ∣ d p : Int w : b * x + c = a * p ⊢ a ∣ b * (x % d) + c

OtherNode.state_before: case intro a b c d x : Int h : a / ↑(a.gcd b) ∣ d p : Int w : b * x + c = a * p ⊢ a ∣ b * (x % d) + c
OtherNode.state_after: case intro.intro a b c x p : Int w : b * x + c = a * p q : Int ⊢ a ∣ b * (x % (a / ↑(a.gcd b) * q)) + c

OtherNode.state_before: case intro.intro a b c x p : Int w : b * x + c = a * p q : Int ⊢ a ∣ b * (x % (a / ↑(a.gcd b) * q)) + c
OtherNode.state_after: case intro.intro a b c x p : Int w : b * x + c = a * p q : Int ⊢ a ∣ a * (b / ↑(a.gcd b) * (q * (x / (a / ↑(a.gcd b) * q))))

OtherNode.state_after: no goals

CommandDoccommentNode.comment:
Given a solution `x` to a divisibility constraint `a ∣ x + c`, then `x % d` is another solution as long as `a | d`.
See `dvd_mul_emod_add_of_dvd_mul_add` for a more general version allowing a coefficient with `x`. -/

Given a solution `x` to a divisibility constraint `a ∣ x + c`, then `x % d` is another solution as long as `a | d`.
See `dvd_mul_emod_add_of_dvd_mul_add` for a more general version allowing a coefficient with `x`. -/

CommandModuledocNode.comment:
There is an integer solution for `x` to the system ``` p ≤ a * x b * x ≤ q d | c * x + s ``` (here `a`, `b`, `d` are positive integers, `c` and `s` are integers, and `p` and `q` are integers which it may be helpful to think of as evaluations of linear forms), if and only if there is an integer solution for `k` to the system ``` 0 ≤ k < lcm a (a * d / gcd (a * d) c) b * k + b * p ≤ a * q a | k + p a * d | c * k + c * p + a * s ``` Note in the new system that `k` has explicit lower and upper bounds (i.e. without a coefficient for `k`, and in terms of `a`, `c`, and `d` only).
This is a statement of "Cooper resolution" with a divisibility constraint, as formulated in "Cutting to the Chase: Solving Linear Integer Arithmetic" by Dejan Jovanović and Leonardo de Moura, DOI 10.1007/s10817-013-9281-x
See `cooper_resolution_left` for a simpler version without the divisibility constraint.
This formulation is "biased" towards the lower bound, so it is called "left Cooper resolution". See `cooper_resolution_dvd_right` for the version biased towards the upper bound. -/

AtomNode.val:
There is an integer solution for `x` to the system ``` p ≤ a * x b * x ≤ q d | c * x + s ``` (here `a`, `b`, `d` are positive integers, `c` and `s` are integers, and `p` and `q` are integers which it may be helpful to think of as evaluations of linear forms), if and only if there is an integer solution for `k` to the system ``` 0 ≤ k < lcm a (a * d / gcd (a * d) c) b * k + b * p ≤ a * q a | k + p a * d | c * k + c * p + a * s ``` Note in the new system that `k` has explicit lower and upper bounds (i.e. without a coefficient for `k`, and in terms of `a`, `c`, and `d` only).
This is a statement of "Cooper resolution" with a divisibility constraint, as formulated in "Cutting to the Chase: Solving Linear Integer Arithmetic" by Dejan Jovanović and Leonardo de Moura, DOI 10.1007/s10817-013-9281-x
See `cooper_resolution_left` for a simpler version without the divisibility constraint.
This formulation is "biased" towards the lower bound, so it is called "left Cooper resolution". See `cooper_resolution_dvd_right` for the version biased towards the upper bound. -/

Comment.text: ## Cooper resolution: small solutions to boundedness and divisibility constraints. -/

Given a solution `x` to a divisibility constraint `a ∣ b * x + c`, then `x % d` is another solution as long as `(a / gcd a b) | d`.
See `dvd_emod_add_of_dvd_add` for the specialization with `b = 1`. -/

Given a solution `x` to a divisibility constraint `a ∣ x + c`, then `x % d` is another solution as long as `a | d`.
See `dvd_mul_emod_add_of_dvd_mul_add` for a more general version allowing a coefficient with `x`. -/

There is an integer solution for `x` to the system ``` p ≤ a * x b * x ≤ q d | c * x + s ``` (here `a`, `b`, `d` are positive integers, `c` and `s` are integers, and `p` and `q` are integers which it may be helpful to think of as evaluations of linear forms), if and only if there is an integer solution for `k` to the system ``` 0 ≤ k < lcm a (a * d / gcd (a * d) c) b * k + b * p ≤ a * q a | k + p a * d | c * k + c * p + a * s ``` Note in the new system that `k` has explicit lower and upper bounds (i.e. without a coefficient for `k`, and in terms of `a`, `c`, and `d` only).
This is a statement of "Cooper resolution" with a divisibility constraint, as formulated in "Cutting to the Chase: Solving Linear Integer Arithmetic" by Dejan Jovanović and Leonardo de Moura, DOI 10.1007/s10817-013-9281-x
See `cooper_resolution_left` for a simpler version without the divisibility constraint.
This formulation is "biased" towards the lower bound, so it is called "left Cooper resolution". See `cooper_resolution_dvd_right` for the version biased towards the upper bound. -/
When `p ≤ a * x`, we can realize `resolve_left` as a natural number. -/
`resolve_left` is bounded above by `lcm a (a * d / gcd (a * d) c)`. -/
Left Cooper resolution of an upper and lower bound with divisibility constraint. -/
Right Cooper resolution of an upper and lower bound with divisibility constraint. -/
